title: Spareribs with Bourbon Marinade
ingredients: 4 pounds of lean spareribs, trimmed of excess fat
instructions: In a shallow ceramic or glass dish combine the bourbon, the soy sauce, the molasses, the chopped onion, the mustard and the Worcestershire sauce.  Add the spareribs, turning them to coat them with the marinade, and let them marinate, covered and chilled, turning them occasionally, for at least 6 hours or overnight.

Drain the spareribs, reserving the marinade, and grill them over glowing coals, basting them with the reserved marinade, for 20 minutes on each side, or until they are crisp on the outside and no longer pink within.  Transfer the spareribs to a cutting board, cut them into serving portions, and arrange them on a heated platter.
Source:  Gastronomie Sans Argent:  Meats to Marinate and Grill, Gourmet Magazine, June 1982.
